contentrichtext.text: The '''European Parliament election of 2004 in Cyprus''' was the election of [[Members of the European Parliament|MEP]] representing [[Cyprus (European Parliament constituency)|Cyprus constituency]] for the 2004-2009 term of the [[European Parliament]]. It was part of the wider [[European Parliament election, 2004|2004 European election]]. The vote took place on June 13. This was the first time Cypriot voters had elected members of the [[European Parliament]].They were election of the six deputies who would be representing the Republic of Cyprus at the [[European Parliament]]. The number of registered voters was 483,311 – out of which 503 were [[Turkish Cypriots]] and 2054 [[Citizenship of the European Union|EU nationals]] – while the total number of people who voted was 350.387 or 72,50% of the registered voters. The number of polling stations was 1077, allocated to each polling district in the following manner: [[Nicosia District|Nicosia]] 416, [[Limassol District|Limassol]] 323, [[Famagusta District|Famagusta]] (Republic of Cyprus-administered area) 50, [[Larnaca District|Larnaca]] 169 and [[Paphos District|Paphos]] 119. The six seats were contested by 59 candidates, belonging to parties or party coalitions or running as individuals. The conservative [[Democratic Rally]] and the [[left-wing]] [[Progressive Party of Working People]] (AKEL) achieved the largest shares of the vote. ==Results== {{European Parliament election, 2004 (Cyprus)}} ==See also== * [[MEPs for Cyprus 2004-2009]] ==External links== * [http://www.hri.org/news/cyprus/cna/2004/04-06-13_2.cna.html New MEPs elected] * [http://www.KyproEkloges.com Elections covered by KyproEkloges.com] {{European Union elections}} {{Cypriot elections}} [[Category:European Parliament election, 2004|Cyprus]] [[Category:European Parliament elections in Cyprus]] [[Category:Elections in Cyprus]] [[Category:2004 in Cyprus]] {{Cyprus-election-stub}}
